intro: Biophytum macrorrhizum, commonly known as the giant root plant, is a striking member of the Phyllanthaceae family native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy roots that can grow quite large, often reaching several meters in length. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a waxy texture, adapted to retain moisture in arid environments. Biophytum macrorrhizum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has also been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
